main.name: Ali M Darwiche
main.description: Here will be your description. Use this to describe what you do or whatever you feel best describes yourself to a potential employer
main.bio: I first began coding as a Full Stack Software Engineer two years ago. My main goal as an new developer was gaining a broad understanding of Mobile and Web Application development. As I traversed different projects, I actively bounced between Frontend and Backend tasks looking to gain a practical understanding of an application's architecure. My current challenge is learning about React.js and discovering the benefits it presents as a frontend framework.
main.contactmessage: Here is where you should write your message to readers to have them get in contact with you.

resume.skillmessage: Here you can create a short write-up of your skills to show off to employers

education.school: The University of Texas at Austin
education.description: I entered UT Austin as a undeclared major August 2012. I had no idea what I wanted to do with my life, but I knew I wanted it to involve three things: Creativity, Leadership, and Technology. I spent the next five years dedicating my studies to growing under those three pillars.

After working in industry for the past year, I've found that the true value of my Computer Science degree came in the diversity of my studies. I distinctly remember solving my first task at The Home Depot using my knowledge of floating-point arithmetic gained from an Operating Systems course. With other courses such as Data Structures, Computer Architerures, Web & Mobile Application Development, and Intro to Security, it's hard not to value my time studying under UT's Computer Science department.

I had two clear goals with my business studies: understanding the plumbing that makes a business work (from the accounting to the customer value), and exploring how leadership can impact company culture and cultivate success.
Describe your experience at school, what you learned, what useful skills you have acquired etc.

testimonials.text: Here you should write some nice things that someone has said about you. No lies though, employers can tell when you are lying.

That Tim Baker must be one of the most brilliant developers I've ever met! It is amazing that nobody has hired him yet. Hey you, you should hire this guy, he may be fresh out of University and have zero on the job experience but I am confident that he will be one of your best developers in no time!
